Physical Layer.description: Physical Layer contains all of the devices, locations, and connectivity in the system.

Devices.description: Devices represent all physical devices involved in the system's operation, such as sensors and hardware endpoints.

Dynamic Edge Devices.description: Dynamic Edge Devices are adaptive, location-dependent devices connecting users to systems.

Operations Devices.description: Devices used for operational workflows, ensuring smooth day-to-day system functioning.

Enterprise Devices.description: Enterprise-level devices supporting organizational goals, such as servers and high-performance hardware.

Multi-Hybrid Cloud.description: Multi-Hybrid Cloud systems represent cloud environments supporting connectivity and scaling across devices.

Communications.description: Communication represents the physical network and protocols connecting devices within locations.

Locations.description: Locations define geographic and logical places in the system where resources are located.

Dynamic Locations.description: Dynamic Locations are movable and adaptive spaces, such as temporary work areas or mobile units.

Operations Locations.description: Locations used for managing and monitoring operational tasks in the system.

Hybrid Offices.description: Merged work and home environments supporting hybrid work practices.

Datacenters.description: Dedicated locations that store and manage system-critical data and applications.

Outsourced Locations.description: Third-party-managed spaces where some system operations are handled.

Logical Layer.description: Software stack of the system, including the middleware, software and applications.

Application Layer.description: Handles user-facing applications, ensuring interaction between system and users.

Distributed Information Management Layer.description: Oversees the efficient distribution and access of system data across modules.

Service Management Layer.description: Monitors and controls services for smooth operation and functionality.

Software Defined Infrastructure.description: Focuses on abstract control over underlying hardware through software.

Physical Layer.description: Acts as the logical representation of the lower physical layer.

Identity Aspect.description: Manages all identity-related elements like authentication and user properties.

Security Aspect.description: Enforces security protocols and measures across all layers of the system.

Process Layer.description: Processes of the system including supporting, strategic and operational processes.

Governance.description: Defines rules, policies, and mechanisms established at a higher level.

Policy Development.description: Formulating policies and regulations. Including ESG.

Legislative Compliance.description: Ensuring adherence to laws and regulations.

Ethics and Integrity.description: Maintaining ethical standards and preventing corruption.

Audit and Oversight.description: Internal and external audits, reviews, and evaluations.

Transparency and Accountability.description: Public reporting, disclosure, and citizen engagement.

Data Governance.description: Governance of data through out the system.

Mission Vision.description: Outlines the organization's goals and purpose in developing its processes.

Vision Formulation.description: Defining the long-term goals and aspirations of the organization to provide a clear direction for the future.

Strategy Management.description: Developing, implementing, and monitoring organizational strategies to align actions with the long-term vision.

Mission Definition.description: Crafting a mission statement focused on the organization's core purpose, goals, and the value it delivers to stakeholders.

Goal Setting and Alignment.description: Establishing specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) goals that align with the mission and vision.

Strategy.description: Strategic planning activities to align system processes with long-term goals.

Strategic Planning.description: Setting long-term goals and priorities for the agency.

Program Evaluation.description: Assessing the effectiveness of government programs.

Resource Allocation.description: Distributing resources based on strategic priorities.

Performance Measurement.description: Monitoring and evaluating agency performance and outcomes.

Innovation New Capability.description: Focuses on exploring innovative improvements to system capabilities.

Develop Digital Services Process.description: Implementing digital government services. DevSecOps, scaling and deployment.

Process Improvement.description: Enhancing efficiency and effectiveness of government processes.

Partnerships Processes.description: Collaborating with private sector for innovation. Including private sector, inter-agencies, and governments.

Citizen Engagement.description: Leveraging new technologies to engage and serve citizens better with built-in feedback loops.

Operational and Delivery.description: Covers routine activities and day-to-day procedures within the organization.

Service Delivery.description: Providing public services to citizens and businesses efficiently and effectively.

Monitoring Processes.description: Tracking and reviewing various operational and service metrics for better performance.

Service Maintenance.description: Ensuring consistent maintenance and functionality of public services.

Operational Technology Management.description: Managing and maintaining technology systems that support operations and services.

Manufacturing Processes.description: Overseeing production processes to ensure quality and efficiency in service-related goods.

Business Continuity Disaster Recovery.description: Developing and maintaining plans to ensure critical business functions during emergencies.

Data Operations Management.description: Managing the storage, processing, and usage of data to ensure its availability and reliability.

Risk Management.description: Manages identification, analysis, and mitigation of risks in various operations.

Risk Identification.description: Identifying potential risks to operations and services.

Risk Analysis.description: Assessing the impact and likelihood of risks.

Mitigation Planning.description: Developing strategies to mitigate identified risks.

Emergency Preparedness.description: Planning and preparation for emergencies and disasters.

Compliance Management.description: Ensuring ongoing adherence to risk-related regulations.

Support.description: Includes supporting actions like troubleshooting and external/internal assistance.

Human Resources.description: Recruiting, hiring, training employees, and managing employee relations to build a productive workforce.

Information Technology (IT).description: Managing IT infrastructure, systems, and services to support organizational goals.

Infrastructure Management.description: Monitoring, maintaining, and developing public infrastructure for efficient operations.

Network Communications Processes.description: Managing systems and processes for seamless and secure network communications.

Facilities Management.description: Overseeing the maintenance, functionality, and safety of physical facilities and buildings.

Financial Management.description: Handling budgeting, financial reporting, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations.

Procurement and Supply Chain.description: Acquiring goods and services necessary to support operations and manage supply chains effectively.

Organizational Layer.description: People centric organizational structure of the system.

Stakeholders.description: All stakeholders involved in decision-making and system requirements.

Personas.description: Different personas representing user groups interacting with the system.

Communication Channels.description: Channels of communication between system users, stakeholders, and decision-makers.

Roles & Responsibilities.description: Defines specific tasks and duties assigned to different entities.

Skills & Competencies.description: Profiles skills and abilities required for system operations.

Structure.description: Maps the hierarchical structure of the organization supporting the system.

Culture & Values.description: Refers to the organizational culture, values, and principles guiding how operations are conducted.
